website_summaries.verdict: Affordable and effective alternative to higher-end probiotic formulas. Safe for both cats and dogs, and works well as an appetite stimulant, too.
pros: Works well with steroids and antibiotics
cons: Not as effective against diarrhea as higher-end probiotics
Not safe for cats with liver-based conditions

customer_reviews.title: Not the same product. Unsafe!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: No inner seal and outter seal was broken. Will not be giving this to my dog. Also whats up with the price: First time i ordered it was 27. Second time 35. Now this time with no seal its 40? Fishy
customer_reviews.author: Tom james

customer_reviews.title: outer seal was fine, gave for two days to my dog with ...
customer_reviews.text: No inner seal, outer seal was fine, gave for two days to my dog with pancreatic enzyme deficiency, she got terrible diarrhea. Weird because it was sold from amazon, but its either a defective batch or simple their supplier is cutting this stuff with something else. I've read reviews online, many other people have had similar issues with weird looking product and ill results.
customer_reviews.author: RottenBiscuit

customer_reviews.title: Short return window
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this before with great results, this time the product disagreed with my dog in a really bad way, i.e. the old silent and deadly. As soon as I stopped using it, the problem stopped. It took me a while to figure this out and the return window is closed. I'm out the $25 or whatever. Too bad. last time I'll purchase a product like this from Amazon
customer_reviews.author: wordsmith

customer_reviews.title: Like Animal Crack on Steroids
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used a couple different animal probiotics and had good success with all of them. But, this one... ...this one is like Animal Crack. They LOVE this stuff. I’ve attached a video showing the dog’s reaction to it when I accidentally dropped the container on the floor. She gobbled the whole pile of powder. And, had NO side effects. And, you can see in the photo how much we put on the cat’s dry food. And, he eats that more than his wet food, now. This stuff is amazing. It’s completeky eliminated our kitty’s loose stools and made both him and the dog more regular. If we could give it ten stars, we would. 😃
customer_reviews.author: JCAdmore

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: We get this from the local pet shop. It totally prevents our dog's horrible farting and butt leakage. We tried purchasing it here, since the price was so much better, and it's NOT the same stuff. The container wasn't properly sealed, there's no seal inside the cap, and the powder isn't even the same color. Within two days of giving our dog this powder (stupid us, we tried), his farting was worse than ever. We sent it back, bought it locally, and the problem vanished.
customer_reviews.author: CRL

customer_reviews.title: Not a quality product
customer_reviews.text: My cat was vomiting a lot. I bought the PetUltimates probiotic to get the vomiting to stop, but then I saw this one and this one is a lot cheaper, so I thought I'd give it a try. I should mention that he had good results with the PetUltimates brand. However, when I switched to this one, the vomiting resumed, even more so than when he didn't even take a probiotic. It was quite obvious that this isn't a quality product. I went back to the PetUltimates brand despite the price. At least that stuff works and doesn't make my cat even sicker!
customer_reviews.author: Ich bin ein Ewald

customer_reviews.title: Powder is like sand not like the original white soft powder, and disturbed my dog's digestive system
customer_reviews.text: Look at the picture, the white is the original product delivered on cans, very soft at the touch, the sand color is the one this bag has, and with a granular sandy type of powder. Just one dinner given to my dogs with this product and they had soft stool the following morning, bordering to diarrea, and that never happened with the original white powder. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo H. La Maestra

customer_reviews.title: Mix in Wet Food or Dissolve in Tiny Amount of Water
customer_reviews.text: One of my cats has frequent digestive problems, either vomiting or diarrhea, and this enzyme seems to help him. When I know for sure he is the one with the problem, I dissolve a 1/4 tsp of the powder in a 1/2 Tbsp of water, suck it up into a syringe and squirt it in his mouth directly. He might sputter a bit, but always forgives me immediately. When I am not sure which cat has the problem, or just for occasional treatment for both of them, I mix a rounded 1/4 tsp in their shared wet food. This has been working for me for years.
customer_reviews.author: Oakley

customer_reviews.title: Suspicious "natural flavoring" added to ingredient list
customer_reviews.text: My dogs & my cat won't eat their food with this product added to it! I've been using NaturVet's Digestive Enzymes Plus Probiotics for a few years now without complaint from my pets, but when I signed up for Amazon's Subscribe & Save, a tan "flavored" powder came instead of the white, unflavored powder I've always purchased. My pets won't touch their food despite what I add to flavor it up. I know that when I see "natural flavoring" in human ingredient lists to stay away from the product, so I advise the same for pet products. (In fact, with pet food products, you usually see flavoring ingredients listed such as "chicken liver flavor" or "beef flavor")
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: Bad Product
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product several times for my dog and this is the first time I've ordered this bag and from this company and I am out the funds. This powder has always been a plain white powder - similar to baby powder. This product looks like there was sand or some sort of grit in it, I'm trying not to think there were dead bugs in it. If I could return the unused product of this I would. No scoop in it and the contents are not expired which is odd.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda C

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my 2 cats, as a recommendation from a friend/fellow cat owner. I have a 9yr old cat that suffers from constipation every now and then, and prescription food and vet visits were really starting to add up. Once I purchased these enzymes, and mixed them along with water, and a quarter teaspoon of organic psyllium husk, my cat became regular!!!! No more constipation! No more vet bills, and no more prescription food, which I swear was making her worse! My younger cat is also going more regularly since the addition. I highly recommend this! Even if your pet is healthy, these enzymes would be good dietary addition, to maintain their digestive health.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: great for sensitive cats
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 cats,1 gets sick a lot: allergies,vomits,gobbles food,then tries to scarf/steal the other, bigger cats dish.She was a runt rescue,with many other cats,and got edged out at feeding time,till we got her.She's probably tripled in size, but still only about 6 lbs(almost 9) And still thinks she's going to starve. This supplement has helped everything. Less allergy symptoms, way less throwing up. And great price here,better than Chewy.
customer_reviews.author: Michele by the sea

customer_reviews.title: Very good product and it was shipped quickly
customer_reviews.text: Veterinarians sometimes disagree on the efficacy of probiotics. All we know is that our cats rarely have any sort of illness or digestive issues. But if and when they have loose stools, a probiotic is a great "fix." We have sprinkled this powder on their food, sometimes mixed it into their food mix (raw and/or canned with some non-GMO, no-grain kibble) and our fussy, spoiled cats never hesitate to lap it up. That said, this product apparently now contains maltodextrin and that's a big problem. Maltodextrin is a cheap, very dangerous filler. It comes mostly from GMO corn. I'm looking for another product.
customer_reviews.author: SAR

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of the 10 oz package.
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this product for years. The last time I ordered it I noticed the option for a 10oz package. I normally buy the 8 oz jar. Well I chose the 10oz package because of the amount being more and the price being less. There was no indication that this was a different formula than the 8oz jar. Not only was it different ingredients but the amount of this product needed per meal for my dog was more than the other formula negating the idea of getting more for the money. I was really bummed with the situation.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Moseley

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second order of this product. The first order, the 8 ounce size was great. The second order, the 16 ounce size came with a taped on, loose lid with the inner seal broken with powder inside the shipping box. The 16 ounce size also was much fluffier and the container was very full with no room for settling. I will buy this product from the pet shop from now on.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Meixner

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous Stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Yesterday's initial (and last!!!) dosage had a terrible and scary effect on our 115-lb pit bull mix! Husband and I spent most of night outside in the yard with him, watching as he frantically ate grass and chomped scores of dropped olives (with pits!), apparently trying to trigger emesis. We were inches away from running him to an emergency clinic about 2 am, when he finally vomited and settled down. He's always had normal stool (which I pick up daily), and been extremely healthy -- so we will not "mess with what's not broken!" This probiotic will be returned!
customer_reviews.author: R WARNAS

customer_reviews.title: Solved our problems!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is incredible. My puppy has a “puny gut” and had chronic soft serve that didn’t go away until we tried this. (Our trainer recommend mixing it with water in the food and letting it sit and digest a bit before feeding.) Her stool is now solid and healthy and she’s much happier. Word to the wise though, if you skip it even one meal, the old problems may resurface. We plan to give this to our dog for life.
customer_reviews.author: RBowers

customer_reviews.title: Terrible experience. Caused diarrhea.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on the recommendation from a friend. Two days after starting to use it, my cat had diarrhea for the first time since I've had him. I thought maybe I used too much of the product or he needed to adjust to it, so I cut back on the amount. But he's had diarrhea again twice and I'm discontinuing this product and throwing it away. I only hope my cat goes back to normal now. Very upset.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Worked so well lol but may not be good for prolonged use
customer_reviews.text: Our older dog who was overweight and was having digestive issues, so we got this product. It worked so well on her. I realized she needed to stop using it because she kept losing weight, lol. I want her to stay in at a healthy weight. Funny part, after getting her off this she had bad gas. Realized the bad gas was due to her needing a kibble change from the dogs regular kibble to senior kibble which had less fat. After the kibble change, her excessive tooting ceased and she's maintaining a healthy weight and we haven't had to use the product again. I still have it around in case any of our other dogs experience digestive problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat was throwing up most nights, regardless of the food we gave him (note that our crazy cat refuses wet food) and this seems to have completely eliminated the problem!
customer_reviews.author: jmc

customer_reviews.title: Digestive problems with your animal? This works wonders!
customer_reviews.text: When my 15 year old cat was having problems with vomiting and looking poorly I had heard probiotics would do wonders for the digestive tract. I bought the small jar, gave 1/4 tsp daily in wet food and in a matter of a couple of days he was awake more often, his brittle hair became soft and the sparkle in his eyes returned! He is 16 years old now and jumped on my dresser for the first time in a couple of years! This small container lasted 6 months. At 16 bucks that's what I call a miracle!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Leduc

customer_reviews.title: Has helped several pets over the years
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to me several years ago and it has been very helpful for several of our pets and fosters over the years.Dogs and cats with various illnesses that caused frequent vomiting, diarrhea, and/or gas have taken this with good results. I just mix the recommended dose into their wet food and let it go to work. I'm currently giving it to a dog with IBD and a senior cat with digestive problems due to an autoimmune disease. This has all but eliminated their episodes of diarrhea and vomiting.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Filler now added to formula
customer_reviews.text: This product used to be great. I noticed this time it is a different color and then looked at the label, it used to be 1/4 tsp per meal, now it is 2 tsp and the first two ingredients are filler, I guess to make it look like you're getting a big bag with more value. My dog has not had diarrhea as other dogs have had, but I will not be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more vomiting and diarrhea!
customer_reviews.text: Our 6 month old cat was throwing up several times a week, most weeks. He also had occasional diarrhea. We took him to the vet and tried a couple things, with no luck. We have been giving him 1/4 tsp of this digestive enzymes every night in a little scoop of tuna, for over a month. The vomiting and diarrhea stopped right away. He seems to have more energy too. It's a huge relief! Update: He has had occasional diarrhea/vomiting, but it's very minor compared to before. Maybe once a month and smaller amounts.
customer_reviews.author: Lisamarie

customer_reviews.title: Started using this after my kitty had a bought with ...
customer_reviews.text: Started using this after my kitty had a bought with diarrhea. Vet gave me a prescription medication, but once that was done, the problem came back. So, I decided to try to solve his tummy issue holistically with organic pureed pumpkin and a recommendation for these digestive enzymes before getting a refill on the prescription. Well the enzymes and pumpkin cleared up the diarrhea! 3yrs later, he had tummy issues again and was prescribed prescription meds, but this time I gave him the digestive enzymes at the same time and continued after meds ran out. Cleared up again! Now he gets this mixed into his canned food daily just as a preventative.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: Waste of my Money, Cats hated it
customer_reviews.text: Cats wouldn't touch the food with this stuff. Now that I have them on healthy food, no more throwing up anyway, this was a waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine HansonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It really helps
customer_reviews.text: Our dog was having loose stools very often and couldn’t hold it before we would go outside. The veterinarian recommended hydrolyzed protein food, but that cost is very exorbitant. We tried these enzymes, which is very much like pancreatic enzymes that people are prescribed. He gets about a teaspoonful daily in his food and has had healthy stools for the last 2 to 3 months. A big improvement and a lot cheaper than hydrolyzed food. I believe this product makes the protein in the food easier for the dog to digest.
customer_reviews.author: MSM1023

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders!
customer_reviews.text: Our 11-ish year old cocker spaniel had lost about 4 pounds, was always “starving” even after eating dinner, her poop smelled awful, and she was acting like she didn’t feel well. We started her on enzymes and NutriCal paste, and she gained the weight back in several weeks. She is acting like her normal self and is doing so much better now. My dad even commented on how much younger she was acting in those several weeks.
customer_reviews.author: EmilyDB

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 year old Shih-poo. He has a sensitive stomach. He also chews on him paws and itches his skin alot. My vet suggested putting him on a digestive enzyme and this one came highly recommended. Since we started using it, I have seen a drastic decrease in the chewing and itching. He also has no more trouble with liquid stools. This product it working great for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Kari & Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Dog Approved!
customer_reviews.text: My dog doesn’t seem to notice it’s there and he is EXTREMELY PICKY and can smell literally the tiniest additions to his food. It is just a white powder that appears virtually odorless. It has GREATLY IMPROVED my dogs digestion. No loose stools when I add this. I try to remember to add it to every meal, but probably round out at about once a day.
customer_reviews.author: BeachyKeen

customer_reviews.title: Good for ferrets too...
customer_reviews.text: I use just a tiny bit and add it to duck soup. This was my final step in reconditioning my ferrets gut. It works really well. I use a tiny bit daily or every other day. After using this she has less bloat, indigestion, and better condition overall. Also, the product has a nice tight fitting lid and the quantity is good so it lasts awhile. I recommend this as post treatment care for ferrets that have been on antibiotics. Use very small quantities as this is dosed for dogs. I use a pinch, the size of a grain of rice, added to 3 tsp of duck soup.
customer_reviews.author: Abby B

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR DOGS WITH PANCREATITIS
customer_reviews.text: Do not give this to a dog with pancreatitis!!!!!! I thought this was like the probiotics that came from the vet. WRONG! It caused an immediate and severe flare up. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie54321

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Don't Have Gas Anymore
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try and curb my dog's behavior of eating my other dog's poop. This is supposed to make them digest food more so thought maybe the poop would be less appetizing. An unexpected effect was that both dogs stopped passing gas almost 100% after I started using this! They used to have super smelly gas, and one of them used to throw up sometimes which I figured was from eating poop. No more gas (just a rare less smelly one here and there) and no more throwing up! The poop eating behavior also ended but that is likely because I started supervising them in the yard instead of letting them play out there by themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Rayna

customer_reviews.title: i love my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I was sad & upset when I spend $35 on it for my two german shepherds, that it had a small piece of tape on the lid. you open it up and seal was broken and stuck to the top of the bottle, not covering the enzymes. I would want to try this again, but maybe from a pet store. The soft chewable pills worked much better. i tried it and it just tasted like baking soda. If i had the money, i would love for a lab to test it and tell me whats all in it.
customer_reviews.author: Christina George

customer_reviews.title: No more stinky cat poo and a lot less puking!
customer_reviews.text: I sprinkle a little of this on my siamese cats' hard and wet food daily and it has really helped cut down on their loose stools, gas, and vomiting. This powder contains ezymes of pre and pro biotics together which is great... the prebiotics give healthy enzymes for the probiotic bacteria to eat. I noticed improvement in my cats' digestion almost immediately. One 1lb container lasts me about 6 months for two cats. Be careful to read the directions and not overdo digestive enzymes... too much can make the problems worse or introduce new issues.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Have a cat that does nothing but puke everywhere? Buy this and problem solved. Love it, love it, love it. I was so sick of cleaning up cat barf. Lol
customer_reviews.author: J Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: I add this to my cats premium real meat/fish canned ...
customer_reviews.text: I add this to my cats premium real meat/fish canned grain free food and sprinkle on top of their grain free dry to help them be able to digest the food (when their bodies had become used to not having to, they stop producing enzymes and then throw up the food). I had to buy spice spoons and use the smallest one, 1/16th of a spoon, to make sure that they get the same amount each time because too much will constipate them. But this, in conjunction with changing their food has, I believe, literally saved one of my cat's lives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: We have a 19 year old kitty and a CH kitty. They both have trouble with loose stools and this medication helps firm them up!😻😻
customer_reviews.author: beth chapman

customer_reviews.title: Instantly made my dos sick!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 dogs. Neither dog liked it...had to hide it in wet food (which I dont normally give them). Then caused major diarrhea and made them drink tons of water, which then led one of my dogs to pee in his crate, which he doesn't normally do. Now one of my dogs looks totally bloated and full on diarrhea. I am no longer giving this junk to my dogs. I tried to return it and wouldn't you know....NO RETURNS ALLOWED on this product. Makes you wonder...
customer_reviews.author: MSJ

customer_reviews.title: Works quickly for diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! My poor cat had diarrhea for 3 days. Her diet is always the same I searched online and found she needed probiotics. I gave her 3 doses in 2 days. I mixed it in her canned food and she didn’t even notice. After the first dose her diarrhea stopped, after the third dose she had a normal poop! She is back to her old self, playful, curious, loving. This is a very inexpensive way to keep her healthy and I plan to give it to her every day from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: I am so happy I found this!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I found "NaturVet digestive enzymes with probiotics"! My cat had been vomiting almost every day, but since I started mixing this with his food, he's only vomited three times in the month I've been using it. It's tasteless and easily mixes with his food, so he eats it without a problem. I feed him Blue Buffalo canned food, and supplement it with Blue Buffalo dry food for sensitive stomachs.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Concern about product safety
customer_reviews.text: There is a piece of scotch tape labelled SAFETY SEAL on the top and the side of the bottle.. The tape can be taken off and taped back on without evidence of tampering. There is no additional seal under the cap. Since the manufacturer felt the need for a safety seal but the tape is worthless, and there was some powder evident on top of the bottle, I was concerned that the product might be adulterated, so I did not use it. Furthermore, no measuring spoon was provided in the container.
customer_reviews.author: Linda N.

customer_reviews.title: We recently adopted a cat that has somewhat of an ...
customer_reviews.text: We recently adopted a cat that has somewhat of an IBS issue. We were told by the vet to try some digestive enzymes. So far this has been agreeing with her tummy. She isn't completely resolved of her ibs D but it has gotten to the point of only one IBS-d every two weeks or do. We ad a small teaspoon amount to her food daily. I would guess that this one container of this will last us close to 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: ... as many different enzymes or probiotics as I would like, but this is a great
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have quite as many different enzymes or probiotics as I would like, but this is a great, less expensive alternative, and I haven't noticed any difference in their behavior or health since switching from a higher level product. My cat suffers from a generally irritable digestive system, so I've tried several types of supplement to keep it under control. I had it under control with another supplement, tried this one to save some money, and he seems just fine. If you just want to improve your pets' health in general, this is a good product, and it's worth a shot to try as a more economical alternative to see if you notice any change or difference.
customer_reviews.author: *~Angela~*

customer_reviews.title: I love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I have a fur baby who had digestive issues/pancreatitis & she used throw up almost daily. Ever since putting this in her food, I've only noticed her vomit maybe once or twice a week now! That's a true miracle for her! I love this stuff. It has truly helped her TREMENDOUSLY!!
customer_reviews.author: Kat luver

customer_reviews.title: Product has changed
customer_reviews.text: This batch of Digestive Enzymes has a different texture. After a few days of using this product, our cat stopped eating; he was vomiting and had diarrhea. When we stopped the using the product he started feeling much better. The vomiting stopped and he no longer had diarrhea.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Miracle Worker
customer_reviews.text: I recently rescued a cat and he had diarrhea. I took him to the vet and they put him on anti-diarrheal meds but they didnt work. I tried these probiotics and within a few days my cats stool was much more normal. These probiotics are a miracle worker for upset pet tummies.
customer_reviews.author: rugbylock

customer_reviews.title: Saved our kitty!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing! We got a kitten from a local rescue center and unbeknownst to us, she had a coccidia infection that eventually ended up killing her litter mate. After almost losing our kitten twice with severe diarrhea and over $1,000 in vet bills, the parasite kept coming back. That was until a guy I work with who breeds Labrador puppies recommended we put her on a probiotic after having a litter of puppies with similar issues. As soon as we started our kitten on these enzymes, it made a world of difference in her poops and energy level. She hasn't had a reoccurrence since and has finally put on weight. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan S Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: Stopped soft stool
customer_reviews.text: Works great! We use it for 2 of our 3 dogs, our German Shepherd and also our Corgi. Both were having issues adjusting to a new dog food, Taste of the Wild, which has good ratings. So I didn't think it was because the food was poor quality. Even with the other dog food -our German Shepherd and Pit Bull mix would eat tree leaves (their instinct to treat upset stomach) and gurge a few times a month. After reading that dogs also sometimes need digestive aids I ordered this product. Both the GS and Corgzilla improved, no more messy, soft poop (except a little after their heartworm pill). Blends in well with the food
customer_reviews.author: C. Salinas

customer_reviews.title: caused foul-smelling gas
customer_reviews.text: My dog was eating the chewable version of this product, but I switched to the powder thinking it would be better. We never had a problem with theNaturVet Digest Enzyme chewable, but my dog developed foul-smelling gas with this product. I believe it is from the fructo-oligosaccharides, which are included as a "food" for beneficial bacteria. I don't think my dog could tolerate these "prebiotics". I just checked the chewable we had been using, and it did contain prebiotics. I may try this powder again, but at a smaller dose. Will update if there is any change.
customer_reviews.author: silvergirlsails

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: Received a used product. No inner seal. No outer seal. It leaked all over. However, the consistency was off. I’m certain the container was tampered with. I should’ve read all the reviews more closely as many other people have had similar issues. I’ve now read that Animal Essentials is the best product to buy.
customer_reviews.author: AAA

customer_reviews.title: Just what my anxious, gut-troubled dog needed!
customer_reviews.text: I started using this a couple of years ago when I got a dog from our local shelter. He is very anxious and reactive, and often has stomach problems. I put a 1/4 of a teaspoon in his breakfast and dinner each day. His stomach has settled down a lot because of it. As an aside, I learned that a lot of dogs with anxiety and reactivity issues have gut problems, too. It makes sense that there's a direct connection between the two, but I was still amazed to see how much the simple addition of this powder helped my dog in so many ways.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: It’s doing the trick
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be doing what it’s supposed to for my 11 year old black lab. I’ve been putting a scoop of the powder on his dry food every evening for a month now and it seems to have eliminated his grumbly tummy and foul smelling farts. My only complaint is that it doesn’t totally adhere to dry food and leaves a bit of residue/mess in the bottom of his bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my dog regular
customer_reviews.text: My dog had been having some GI issues. Since adding this powder to her food every day she has been much more regular and her stool much more solid. Bonus is that this is a powder not a pill and the dog doesn't seem to notice it being added to her food (she always finds the tiniest pill among her food and spits that out on the floor next to her food dish).
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Bender

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I buy the large container for my dog because 1) she loves it. 2) She has a tendency to eat anything she can find.... dead, alive, or not moving fast enough. She is a working dog and is out chasing cattle daily. Since I have been using this with her food, she hasn't had any digestive issues. The thing that I have noticed the most is she never has smelly gas. Before using this product, she could clear out the barn with the smell of her gas. I highly recommend this product for working dogs.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: No inner seal, just a piece of tape across the lid, and a weird sticker cut in half covering the barcode. Will not be giving this to my dog. Not returnable. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie M Yankes

customer_reviews.title: Senior doggo must!
customer_reviews.text: My senior lab/doberman is very thankful for this pre and probiotic. He has issues going potty most days... I sprinkle some of this every morning and it most definitely helps. There was a week I ran out and he had trouble that entire week until I got my next shipment of this in. I've reordered many times. Great product. No scent or flavor noted by me.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 75 pound Malinois. I feed him two cups of dog food twice a day. I started giving him a half teaspoon of the enzymes every morning for about 2 weeks. He did very well and only regurgitated twice during that 2 week period. I then bumped it up to a half teaspoon in the morning and a half in the evening. He is now doing great and rarely vomits. What a big change this product has made in his (and ours) quality of life.
customer_reviews.author: EL Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Not helpful
customer_reviews.text: I can’t speak for flavor or scent. It simply isn’t helping my dog one way or another, as compared to other enzymes I tried. She still eats grass, still has guck in her eyes, bad breath. Her energy is high, but she is high energy regardless. I won’t buy this again. I may go back to a previous enzyme powder that was helping with her breath.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: This product has helped my aging Lab/Golden quite a bit. He always had digestive issues that I won't go into detail with. When he went to the kennel, he would come back feeling better. The kennel owner told me she uses this with all the dogs that visit there. I started using it at home and it has been such a blessing. He has not had digestive troubles in the year since we started using this. It really helped us that much. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn L. Zajk

customer_reviews.title: Cured Scout's bad mornings.
customer_reviews.text: I waited over a month before posting this. For quite a while Scout, our chiwienie, would wake up feeling crappie. A bit of Googling led us to this product. We feed him a home made very healthy dog food but apparently as dogs get older their system needs a little help. After a few days Scout consistently woke up playful. Every single day. Try the small one first. If it works get the big one next. huge savings.
customer_reviews.author: Tulsa Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Big Difference! Also Cost Effective
customer_reviews.text: My rescued Doberman girl used to have loose stools off and on, eat grass and get agitated (stomach ache?). Now her stools are formed, no more eating grass, and she seems like she is more playful and feels better. Also, I like the fact that its an odorless fine powder so it sticks to your favorite kibble and she doesn't refuse it. This jar should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Bud

customer_reviews.title: Ginger, prebiotic, and stevia!
customer_reviews.text: READ the ingredients. This is not the same as the plastic canister. This has ginger and according to description it has stevia in it. There's no need for the sweetener. I'm returning this product. I thought it was the same as the one in the canister. My diabetic cat doesn't need the extras.
customer_reviews.author: S. E. Gable

customer_reviews.title: Diarrhea gone!
customer_reviews.text: Our German Shepherd got Parvo at 9 weeks, he made a full recovery and now at 1 year old he started having intestine issues, constant diarrhea and weight loss . We took him to the vet and they said nothing was wrong. I did some googling and read that sprinkling enzymes on dog food will help them digest properly. Within a couple days of sprinkling this in every meal the diarrhea is gone and currently he is up 10 lbs! We’re on our 3rd purchase of these specific enzymes and now I go for the 1lb tub.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Picky eater with sensitive tummy turned into a hungry pig!
customer_reviews.text: Enabled my extremely picky eater to eat again. My dog would skip meals or nibble here and there for the past 7 months. He was losing weight and he would puke bile from not wanting to eat. After mixing this in and giving him acid reduction pills, he became a new dog. He now eats and hungrily gulps down food. He's excited about breakfast and dinner now. I never thought I'd get to see my dog enjoy his food. Worth it and I'm glad this supplement helps his sensitive tummy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely recommend these! We use it with every meal to help digest!! This has made a huge difference especially since our oldest would puke every meal up now hardly has digestive issues!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Hates It
customer_reviews.text: It's rather unfortunate that I can't return this product. My dog simply won't eat his food with this on it. He hates it. I believe in probiotics & enzymes for our furry family but I can't rate how well the product works since my dog won't eat it.
customer_reviews.author: DeeDee

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as I've purchased in my local pet stores
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the same name brand product in my local pet store and it's done wonders for my pets, however this wasn't the same stuff. In my previous purchases, the product was pure white, silky smooth and my dogs loved it. This purchase was grainy, beige and my dogs won't eat it. I made sure that everything matched from my canister to the pouch, but it's not the same. Waste of money. :-(
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: helped our Great Dane’s poop go from way too soft, to just about perfect.
customer_reviews.text: helped our Great Dane’s poop go from way too soft, to just about perfect. He does not have allergies and he is on a second tier food. Top tier was too rich and too high in protein for him. we add a tiny scoop to his dry food, it dissolves instantly with a small amount of water in the bowl. he doesn’t seem to notice it. we have been using it for 10 months and we will continue .
customer_reviews.author: Phx

customer_reviews.title: good for my cats
customer_reviews.text: Have used this for 4 years for my cats. I mix about 1/8-1/4 teaspoon with each serving of cat food. One cat has IBS/IBD (he has gut issues, anxiety, and allergies) One cat is a manx (They can have trouble pooping because no tail = no leverage to push out poop) Third cat is possibly immunocompromised (gets inflammation easily) They're all on a diet of (dry) Natures Variety Instinct Limited Ingredient Turkey, and (wet) Wellness Turkey Pate.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bussert

customer_reviews.title: Won't ever stop using this!
customer_reviews.text: I believe that this digestive enzyme powder has made my dog feel much better. He used to eat grass like a horse, almost desperately. His stomach was frequently upset. I had to race him to the dog poop and pick it up to keep him from eating it (sorry if this is gross). I've heard that dogs do this because they are lacking enzymes that aid with digestion. I have been feeding NaturVet Digestive Enzymes Pus Probiotics for a few months and, while he still enjoys his grass, he has stopped eating poop and he hasn't had a single bout of nausea or diarrhea. NaturVet, my dog and I both thank you!
customer_reviews.author: dogzmom

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty solid product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 year old greyhound that has had rounds of antiparasitic and antibiotic meds recently to try to help with all of the stomach upsets that has caused. He has a sensitive stomach anyways and seems to have random bouts of nausea. This is a pretty solid product, and at a fair price. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because his stomach problems haven't completely gone away and he still shows signs of nausea after eating occasionally like excessivley licking the air and eating a ton of grass. But he rarely has gas now, his stools have firmed up, and his nausea has definitely been reduced.
customer_reviews.author: Caytlin B.

customer_reviews.title: Dogs like the taste.
customer_reviews.text: I believe that dogs need digestive enzymes, just like adults do. Digestion is one of the major bodily functions. So, I add these enzymes to their meals. They gobble their food down so they must like the taste. It works for my dogs. They eliminate regularly and never have a problem with going.
customer_reviews.author: MarleneLouiseTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Used it on my cats
customer_reviews.text: Does not help at all with hairballs. Strange. If it does what it is supposed to do, it should have helped. Feed it to four cats daily. Because of this I would say it is worthless. I expected something. This did nothing. Also, nothing to measure with comes in package. Use a spoon or whatever you like best IF you buy this stuff. No good.
customer_reviews.author: Data

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a week and it is amazing! One of my cats has had a never ending UTI (3 months now) and this seems to have nipped in the bud! Plus my cats' (I have 3) litter box doesn't stink anymore--which is crazy! I've been looking for better litter, and now I don't have to keep experimenting! I'm very happy with this and will be ordering again soon!!
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle

customer_reviews.title: No inner or outer seal...
customer_reviews.text: Just got it. No inner seal, the other seal was a minuscule piece of stuck plastic. Very hesitant to give it to my cat because I'm not sure if the product is what it's supposed to be. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cannot tell that it is mixed into the food!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very gassy border collie mix. It does not matter what I feed him, he passes terrible smelling gas. Now that I put the digestive enzymes in his wet food each night he never has gas. His poop is always regular too. It mixes into wet dog food really well and he can't tell it is there. It has no odor either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Formulation seems different but is getting the job done.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second bottle I've purchased, the first being in 2013. Somehow, this formulation seems different, judging by my dog's stool (which changed practically overnight when I got the second bottle). However, it seems to be keeping the stool solid. There just seems to be more gas. This might not be how your dog reacts, though.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Dog-Lover

customer_reviews.title: My cat was vomiting irregularly, but not anymore
customer_reviews.text: My six year old cat, and had been vomiting for almost daily for nearly a year. I had taken him to the vet multiple times, and they told me he had an ulcer. The veterinarian prescribed him several medicines, and changed his food to very expensive prescription food. The medicine would help for awhile, but he would go back to vomiting again. This cost me nearly 800 dollars in treatment. I purchased this stuff a few months ago based on other reviews. I am very happy with it, and so is my cat. He's vomited maybe twice in the last 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Shammah Chancellor

customer_reviews.title: Keep your precious pets healthy
customer_reviews.text: No flavor or scent, just mix the powder into the dog food. If you only feed your dog kibble, the best vets will admit that they will be nutrition deficient. It's important to add digestive enzymes to their food to help their immune system so they stay healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Saves my floors
customer_reviews.text: My dog throws up a lot and has unexpected poops-this is a life saver. A 1/4 teaspoon on her food. Also way cheaper than the purina pouches!
customer_reviews.author: M.C.

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog with kidney disease and he is very thin. I've tried a lot of different dog foods, homemade diets and supplements to put weight on him. Nothing has worked. Then I added these digestive enzymes to his diet and he gained weight within a week! I was so impressed and grateful. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Kay

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Does Not Tolerate This Product Very Well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this protect for my dog, because she has a sensitive stomach. I followed the instructions and gave her the exact amount that was listed on the back of the label. I tried this product for 3 days, and then I quit giving it to my dog. She would throw up white, frothy stuff after each meal that had this product on it. I purchased this product because it had good reviews from pet owners, but for some reason my my furbaby does not tolerate it very well. I will not be giving her this product anymore. This maybe a good product for other pet owners, but it is not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Angela C.

customer_reviews.title: Helped my dog's terrible allergies!
customer_reviews.text: He used to get sores all over his paws, legs, and face and he looked like he was being starved, he was so skinny. This product greatly reduced the medication he must take and now he is gaining weight and instead of starving, he just looks slim. With more time I don't doubt that he will keep gaining weight. Now all my dogs and cats are on it!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Delemont

customer_reviews.title: This works!
customer_reviews.text: This works for my kitten who was having diarrhea or soft stools from the time I brought him home. This powder dissolves into his canned food and is either tasteless or he doesn't mind the taste. It takes daily use for about a week or so for it to work, but by now, his stools are firm. No more metronidazole, thank you. I will continue to use this daily since it is relatively inexpensive as well as effective.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Wendy L. Brand

customer_reviews.title: NaturVet
customer_reviews.text: I don’t want to mislead anyone with a rating of this product. I received NaturVet on Wednesday of this week and it is much too soon to have an opinion. I can say there is no smell and powder is very fine. My dog is a very picky eater so I can’t say she doesn’t like it but will eat along with her food when she decides she is hungry enough to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Becky S.

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful product for anyone who prepares a raw diet for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product for anyone who prepares a raw diet for their pets. I've been using this for years in the raw diet for my cats and one dog. Life span of my pets is usually 15-20 years. It's just one of the supplements I add to make a balanced diet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An EXCELLENT “answer” for my dog’s tummy problems
customer_reviews.text: I was truly AMAZED by the size of the container. It is almost double the size for the same price for what I got at Pet Supermarket!! This does a wonderful job to help my 14 year old dog digest his food easily and he never has any GI DISTRESS anymore. He used to be super miserable. This product has worked miracles!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my dog. Had to go back to the more expensive prescription probiotic.
customer_reviews.text: My dog had been on the Nutramax Proviable-DC probiotic for almost three years. At $.40 - $.60 per capsule, I was looking at for a cheaper alternative. This did not prove to be that alternative. While far cheaper, after just a couple days, my dog starting throwing up after eating this in her morning meal.
customer_reviews.author: thesoundguy

customer_reviews.title: No seal - defective product
customer_reviews.text: Received product with no inner or outer seal. Made dog sick. Definitely avoid the product if it came with no seal. Amazon customer service was great on the issue.
customer_reviews.author: milka33

customer_reviews.title: What happened to the white powder formula?
customer_reviews.text: I am a long time customer. My dog has digestive issues so I started using this a couple years ago. It used to be a white powder and worked great. The formula was changed and it’s now a brown powder with fillers. My dog got sick from the new formula and is allergic to some of the ingredients. What’s really strange is that I just bought 3 bags of it. 2 had brown powder on the graphic and one had white powder on the graphic on the bag but all had brown powder. I would love to be contacted by the company to explain to me what’s going on. Otherwise, I’m no longer a customer.
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: It worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: My dogs started eating feces out of the blue, and after trying other things, I started feeding them this probiotic powder. It worked like a charm! This is a high quality product. I have purchased it more than once, and will continue to do so.
customer_reviews.author: ebean

customer_reviews.title: I have 15 and none can take it
customer_reviews.text: No smell, no taste that I can tell, & thin powder that dissolves well. BUT I have 15 fur babes, and even with giving just a little to start out, everyone had soft BMs to diarrhea, and a couple with nausea. It didn't get better!
customer_reviews.author: April M Newell

customer_reviews.title: Amazing !
customer_reviews.text: I rarely leave reviews but had to this time . My 8 month GSD has a sensitive stomach since we brought him home . We’ve tried multiple high quality foods but he still had mushy poop multiple times per day . This stuff is seriously miracle. His poop is now firm and easy to clean thank god! He also poops less and absorbing the nurtrients . Great price too !
customer_reviews.author: LauraS

customer_reviews.title: Gut health is vital to overall health
customer_reviews.text: I've been rescuing animals for decades, and this product is priceless for restoring optimal health. I have six cats and one dog, and they all get it. I notice their nails grow faster, which means they have more energy to put into growing nails. The two with digestive issues improved after being on this for a while. The others, I don't see a huge change, but I believe it's very helpful for them all.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Percy

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for years now as I have two yorkies with delicate tummies. I used to buy it from a boutique pet store but I moved away and haven't been able to get it at my local stores. I'm so glad I found it on Amazon and I'm so glad it's a decent price. I decant it into a clean salt/herb shaker and sprinkle it on my dogs food before they eat. They have decent shaped poops and their tummies seem a little better. Try it.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: LIFE CHANGING!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cat has been puking daily for years and this is the ONLY thing that has helped!!! Seriously life changing!!! My vet recommended antacid pills for the puking, but I just couldn't get him to eat them. My local pet shop, Protein for Pets, recommended this product and I'm forever grateful!!!
customer_reviews.author: ms

customer_reviews.title: Lasts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my senior cat who was recently diagnosed with renal failure. We try to give him Azodyl each day (a pill form prebiotic and probiotic recommended for cats in renal failure but is a capsule which is VERY DIFFICULT to get into our cat) so I use this instead. It is very important from what I hear to use prebiotics and probiotics to remove toxins from the body through the digestive tract and relieve the kidneys from doing that job. When Azodyl's can't be swallowed I turn to this product. It is important to remember to keep refrigerated since live organisms or included.
customer_reviews.author: LadyBlue

customer_reviews.title: Love our pets
customer_reviews.text: I wish EVERY pet was given this with their meals. Keeps them healthy less need for Vet visits. Enzymes and Probiotics which are necessary for good health for pets and their humans alike. When food is processed it kills most if not all the live whole enzymes so the digestive system pulls the needed enzymes from other parts of the body... Let this go on year after year and disease and early aging is the result. This product is well formulated and had PROVEN to improve the health of my pets. Allowing my 13 year old Queensland healer to live another happy year after we all thought she was seeing her last month.
customer_reviews.author: Malia S

customer_reviews.title: Nature Vet Enzymes
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Nature vet for a couple of years with my Bully Pitts and they have no issues eliminating and their coats are smooth and shiny. I also give them organic yogurt or Kefir or skyr interchangeably with their meals.
customer_reviews.author: Storming Mountain

product_meta.title: NaturVet – Digestive Enzymes - Plus Probiotics & Prebiotics – Helps Support Diet Change & A Healthy Digestive Tract – for Dogs & Cats
feature_bullets: Digestive Enzymes Plus Probiotics & Prebiotics contains a source of live viable naturally occurring microorganisms recommended to support a healthy digestive tract.
Provides Probiotics for dogs and cats with essential enzymes to help break down food for optimal utilization of nutrients.
Great for food transitioning, sensitive stomachs and flatulence, this product helps replace natural enzymes lost in food processing. For use in dogs and cats over the age of 6 weeks.
Please note: No Scoop Provided. Use whatever scoop method you prefer! Inner safety seal is designed to come off when top is opened for your ease of convenience.
NASC, cGMP Compliant, Manufactured in the USA
